name: Chris Heenan
title: Partner
credentials: J.D., University of Notre Dame Law School, 2001
B.A., Labor Studies, Penn State University, 1998
Licensed in Pennsylvania, Ohio, and West Virginia
Member, Labor and Employment Relations Association
bio: Chris Heenan is a leading labor relations attorney with extensive experience representing both management and labor organizations in collective bargaining, grievance arbitration, and union-related litigation. As a former Labor Relations Specialist with the National Labor Relations Board, Chris brings insider knowledge of federal labor law enforcement to his practice. He advises employers on union avoidance strategies, collective bargaining negotiations, and compliance with the National Labor Relations Act. Chris also represents labor unions in organizing campaigns, contract negotiations, and grievance proceedings. His practice includes handling unfair labor practice charges, workplace safety issues under OSHA, and employment discrimination cases with labor law components. Chris's balanced perspective, having worked with both sides of labor relations, allows him to find practical solutions to complex workplace disputes. He regularly conducts training sessions for supervisors and HR professionals on labor law compliance and has extensive experience in industries including manufacturing, construction, and public sector employment.
